Class: RegionProvider

RegionProvider

new RegionProvider(regionType, properties)

Instantiate a region provider by giving it an entry from the region mapping JSON file.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
regionType String

Unique text identifier.
properties Object

Properties as given in configuration file.

_idIndex :Object

Look-up table of attributes, for speed.

Type:
  • Object
Source:
  • Map/RegionProvider.js, line 119

aliases :Array.<String>

List of aliases which will be matched against if found as column headings.

Type:
  • Array.<String>
Source:
  • Map/RegionProvider.js, line 67

dataReplacements :Array.<Array>

Array of [regex, replacement] arrays which will be applied to each user-provided ID element before matching is attempted. For example, [ [ ' (.)$' ], '' ] will convert 'Baw Baw (S)' to 'Baw Baw'

Type:
  • Array.<Array>
Source:
  • Map/RegionProvider.js, line 84

description :String

A text description of this region type, which may feature in the user interface.

Type:
  • String
Source:
  • Map/RegionProvider.js, line 51

disambigProp

The property within the same WFS region that can be used for disambiguation.

Source:
  • Map/RegionProvider.js, line 92

layerName :String

Name of the WMS layer where these regions are found.

Type:
  • String
Source:
  • Map/RegionProvider.js, line 57

regionDisambigIdsFile :String

JSON file for disambiguation attribute, as per regionIdsFile.

Type:
  • String
Source:
  • Map/RegionProvider.js, line 133

regionIdsFile :String

The URL of a pre-generated JSON file containing just a long list of IDs for a given layer attribute, in the order of ascending feature IDs (fids). If defined, it will be used in preference to requesting those attributes from the WFS server.

Type:
  • String
Source:
  • Map/RegionProvider.js, line 127

regionProp :String

WMS attribute whose value will correspond to each region's code.

Type:
  • String
Source:
  • Map/RegionProvider.js, line 46

regions :Array.<Object>

Array of attributes of each region, once retrieved from the server.

Type:
  • Array.<Object>
Source:
  • Map/RegionProvider.js, line 113

regionType :String

String uniquely identifying this type of region (eg, 'sa4')

Type:
  • String
Source:
  • Map/RegionProvider.js, line 40

server :String

URL of the WMS server

Type:
  • String
Source:
  • Map/RegionProvider.js, line 62

serverReplacements :Array.<Array>

Array of [regex, replacement] arrays which will be applied to each ID element on the server side before matching is attempted. For example, [ [ ' (.)$' ], '' ] will convert 'Baw Baw (S)' to 'Baw Baw'

Type:
  • Array.<Array>
Source:
  • Map/RegionProvider.js, line 74

textCode :Boolean

Whether this region type uses text codes, rather than numeric. It matters because numeric codes are treated differently by the CSV handling models.

Type:
  • Boolean
Source:
  • Map/RegionProvider.js, line 107

uniqueIdProp :string

Returns the name of a field which uniquely identifies each region. This field is not necessarily used for matching, or of interest to the user, but is needed for reverse lookups. This field must count from zero, and features must be returned in sorted order.

Type:
  • string
Source:
  • Map/RegionProvider.js, line 100

Apply an array of regular expression replacements to a string.

Parameters:
Name Type Description

replacementsProp String

Name of a property containing [ [ regex, replacement], ... ], where replacement is a string which can contain '$1' etc.

Name Type Description

Name Type Description

Pre-generates a function which quickly turns a value into a colour.

Parameters:
Name Type Description

Array of values.

should be function(val) { return [r,g,b,a]; }
Source:
  • Map/RegionProvider.js, line 431
Returns:

Function of type f(regionIndex) { return [r,g,b,a]; } which may return undefined.

Type
function

getRegionValues(dataset, regionVariable, rowList) → {Object}

Provides a list of values for each region, based on a provided dataset.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
dataset DataTable
regionVariable String
rowList Array

Optional array of integers: only show these rows from dataset. Used for time-filtering.
Source:
  • Map/RegionProvider.js, line 367
Returns:

Object containing properties: regionValues: Sparse array of values corresponding to the provided list. ambiguousMatches: Object whose keys are IDs of regions that had more than one row match against them. failedMatches: Object whose keys are unmatched region codes. successes: Number of successful matches. totalRows: Number of attempted matches.

Type
Object

loadRegionIDs() → {Object}

Given an entry from the region mapping config, load the IDs that correspond to it, and possibly to disambiguation properties.

Source:
  • Map/RegionProvider.js, line 253
Returns:

Promise that returns true if IDs were loaded for the first time, or false if already loaded.

Type
Object

loadRegionsFromWfs()

Fetch a list of region IDs in feature ID (FID) order by querying a WFS server. This is a slower fall-back method if we don't have a pre-computed JSON list available.

Source:
  • Map/RegionProvider.js, line 163
Returns:

Object in same format as needed by processRegionIds

processRegionIds()

Given a list of region IDs in feature ID order, apply server replacements if needed, and build an index.

Source:
  • Map/RegionProvider.js, line 201
